design_audit.selection_story: Cross-sectional county-level regression exploiting spatial variation in historical black lynching rates (1882-1930) to estimate persistent effects on contemporary (2000-2012) black voter registration, conditional on historical and state controls
design_audit.data_note: Panel data (multiple elections per county) is collapsed to county-level cross-section via Stata collapse before main analysis (Createmain.do line 200). Sample restricted to counties with complete data on all controls including contemporary vars (N=267).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Black voter registration rate (registered black voters / black voting-age population * 100)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Historical black lynching rate per capita (black lynchings 1882-1930 / black population 1900 * 10000)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Conditional association between historical black lynching intensity and contemporary black voter registration, interpreted as persistent causal effect under selection-on-observables
claim_object.target_population: Counties in six Southern US states (AL, FL, GA, LA, NC, SC) with complete data

constraints.functional_form_policy: outcome transforms (asinh, log1p) treated as estimand-preserving for direction/significance but note that coefficient interpretation changes from level to semi-elasticity; treatment variable redefinition (alternative denominators, alternative data source) treated as estimand-preserving since the concept is 'historical lynching rate'
constraints.sample_restriction_note: Table B3 cap/drop: the code first replaces Blackrate_regvoters>100 with 100 (cap), then runs one regression on capped data and one regression dropping obs<100 on the ALREADY CAPPED data. The runner must apply these in order, not independently.

canonical.notes: Homoskedastic OLS SEs (the paper uses plain regress with no robust or cluster option in Maindo.do). This matches the published standard errors.

variants.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust HC1 SEs as a robustness check
Cluster SEs at state level (6 states -- very small number of clusters, interpret with caution)

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table 2 Col 2: regress Blackrate_regvoters lynchcapitawhite + historical controls + state FE. Should show null effect.
Table 2 Col 3: regress Whiterate_regvoters lynchcapitamob + historical controls + state FE. Should show null effect.
Table 2 Col 4: regress Whiterate_regvoters lynchcapitawhite + historical controls + state FE. Should show null effect.
